channel.title: Kid Ornery presents...
channel.description: A mix of interesting music from Kid Ornery and his associates. Free Jazz, Drone, Noise, Improv, and general weirdness from Last Bastions, The Defenestration Unit, Kid Ornery, Avijit, and many more...
channel.itunes:subtitle: Crazy Sounds from Houston, Tx.
channel.itunes:author: Kid Ornery
channel.itunes:summary: A mix of interesting music from Kid Ornery and his associates. Free Jazz, Drone, Noise, Improv, and general weirdness from Last Bastions, The Defenestration Unit, Kid Ornery, Avijit, and many more...

item.title: Hark the Herald Angels Scream!
item.description: Merry Christmas! I present to you the ghost of Christmas past - TDU style! We gave away quite a few of these the year we recorded them... We aren't doing Christmas songs tonight at Bohemeo's (www.bohemeos.com), so I thought I'd give them to you here... enjoy! 1. Joy to the World 2. We Three Kings 3. Sitting on Santa's Lap 4. HARK!
item.dc:creator: Kid Ornery
item.itunes:summary:
Merry Christmas!
I present to you the ghost of Christmas past - TDU style!
We gave away quite a few of these the year we recorded them...
We aren't doing Christmas songs tonight at Bohemeo's (www.bohemeos.com), so I thought I'd give them to you here...
enjoy!
1. Joy to the World 2. We Three Kings 3. Sitting on Santa's Lap 4. HARK!

item.title: The Sweatbox Sessions - Ornery Master
item.description: I present to you - complete for the first time anywhere - the only studio album ever recorded by any version of The Defenestration Unit anywhere... Recorded under the guidance of Mr. Tim Kerr at The Sweatbox in Austin - we spent the band fund on recording it - and then that version of the band broke up... We were never quite sure what to do with it... Well, I went and sequenced it tonight, compressed it a bit, and "screw"ed around with one song (you'll know it when you hear it)... We recorded all weekend. Tim had us record tracks of us making noise and whooping and hollering and such over the tunes when we were done... I was so delirious by the time we got to "leroy's groove" that they had to cut that track pretty early on as I became very obnoxious almost right away! go me! anyway, this is not "the definitive sweatbox sessions" because there probably never will be one, but it's a version of what that album may have sounded like... 1. Asskicker Jones 2. Earth 3. HPW 4. Space is the Place 5. Caravan 6. In 6 7. I Put a Spell on You 8. Leroy's Groove TDU was: Charlie Naked - Saxophones Kid Ornery - Trombone Jack Babylon - Trumpet Jim Otterson - Guitar Leroy Bell - Bass Vaughan Boone - Drums w/ Carl Smith - Sax on "Space is the Place" and "Earth" enjoy!
item.dc:creator: Kid Ornery
item.itunes:summary:
I present to you - complete for the first time anywhere - the only studio album ever recorded by any version of The Defenestration Unit anywhere... Recorded under the guidance of Mr. Tim Kerr at The Sweatbox in Austin - we spent the band fund on recording it - and then that version of the band broke up... We were never quite sure what to do with it... Well, I went and sequenced it tonight, compressed it a bit, and "screw"ed around with one song (you'll know it when you hear it)...
We recorded all weekend. Tim had us record tracks of us making noise and whooping and hollering and such over the tunes when we were done... I was so delirious by the time we got to "leroy's groove" that they had to cut that track pretty early on as I became very obnoxious almost right away! go me!
anyway, this is not "the definitive sweatbox sessions" because there probably never will be one, but it's a version of what that album may have sounded like...
1. Asskicker Jones 2. Earth 3. HPW 4. Space is the Place 5. Caravan 6. In 6 7. I Put a Spell on You 8. Leroy's Groove
TDU was: Charlie Naked - Saxophones Kid Ornery - Trombone Jack Babylon - Trumpet Jim Otterson - Guitar Leroy Bell - Bass Vaughan Boone - Drums
w/ Carl Smith - Sax on "Space is the Place" and "Earth"
enjoy!

item.title: The Stooges
item.description: Ever since I started home recording I knew I'd do a cover of this album at some point. It changed my life... I've worked on it off and on over the years and finally, maybe a year ago, I was done with it... well, here it is. It's all me, except for some drum samples of Vaughan Boone. 1. 1969 2. I Wanna Be Your Dog 3. We Will Fall 4. No Fun 5. Real Cool Time 6. Ann 7. Not Right 8. Little Doll some tracks I'm happier with than others, but at least it's done, and now it is out there... enjoy!
item.dc:creator: Kid Ornery
item.itunes:summary:
Ever since I started home recording I knew I'd do a cover of this album at some point. It changed my life... I've worked on it off and on over the years and finally, maybe a year ago, I was done with it... well, here it is.
It's all me, except for some drum samples of Vaughan Boone.
1. 1969 2. I Wanna Be Your Dog 3. We Will Fall 4. No Fun 5. Real Cool Time 6. Ann 7. Not Right 8. Little Doll
some tracks I'm happier with than others, but at least it's done, and now it is out there...
enjoy!

item.title: mixed nuts
item.description: here's another interesting mix o' craziness from the hard drive of Kid Ornery: 1. Avijit - Exclusive Tanning 2. The Defenestration Unit - Little Things Get Bigger 3. Kid Ornery - Georgia - from the mythic and presumed lost "accomodation" sessions 4. Friends - Beat10 - another presumed abandoned project - though it may be revived one day... 5. Something to close with - synapse - synapse was Robert Pearson, David Maddox, Kid Ornery, and I think on this recording, Dan McMahon...

item.title: Fist of Kong - Heinous Retribution - A Compilation
item.description: A rarity here at Kid Ornery presents, a podcast full of music I don't play on. I asked Charlie Naked to compile some Fist of Kong for me... and here it is... I do play with FOK occasionally, just not on any of these tracks... but you'll enjoy them anyway. This is in honor of Charlie Naked starting his own podcast over at http://charlienaked.podomatic.com check it out!!! FOK PODCAST, November 16, 2006: =============================== 1. 4th Piece, July 11, 2006: Charlie Naked, Danny McMahon, Jim Otterson, Robert Pearson, Rose Lange, Melisa Rose, John Atlas 2. Second Duet, June 13, 2006: Charlie Naked, Danny McMahon 3. 2nd Piece, August 8, 2006: Charlie Naked, Danny McMahon, Robert Pearson, Melisa Rose, Tom Zermeno 4. 4th Piece, August 30, 2006: Charlie Naked, Danny McMahon, John Atlas

item.title: TDU Live at Bohemeo's - 11/08/06
item.description: Here's last week Bohemeo's gig... more or less... TDU is was - Charlie Naked - Saxamaphones, Percussion, etc. Mike Switzer - Trombone, Percussion, etc. Jim Otterson - Guitar, etc. Tom Zermeno - Percussion, Vox, etc. Jeff Miller - Bass, etc. Kirk Suddreath - Drums, Percussion, etc. The pic is from one of our shows at Helios - from l to r Lisa, Lara, Dawn, Ruth all amazing women, and all TDU fans... Come see us on Wednesdays... www.bohemeos.com

item.title: The Defenestration Unit - Live at Java Junction - Oct. 8 2006
item.description: This is for the dancing girls and the piano guy and the other guy not that one guy though the one who played and brought his family and then left and took them with him when he was done... it's not for him. TDU is/was/whatever: Charlie Naked - Saxophones, mouthpieces, percussion, etc. Kid Ornery - Trombone, Vocals, etc. Jim Otterson - Guitars, etc. Jeff Miller - Bass, etc. Tom Madcarrots - Percussion, etc. Kirk "Monkeyboy" Suddreath - Drums, percussion, etc.

item.title: The Adding Machine Band - Opener - Rehearsal
item.description: Here's a brief sampler of the work of "The Adding Machine Band". They are under the direction of Charlie Naked and feature: Charlie Naked - Guitar Ken Watkins - Guitar Jeff Miller - Bass Ruthie Langston - Cello Pete Sullivan - Saxophones Phil Krieg - Theremin Tom Zermeno - Percussion They are providing all the music and sound effects for my production of Elmer Rice's "The Adding Machine". They are also providing all the pre-show music - and here's a sample of them practicing for that... enjoy, and come see one of the last two performances if yr in Houston... Kid Ornery
item.dc:creator: Kid Ornery
item.itunes:summary:
Here's a brief sampler of the work of "The Adding Machine Band". They are under the direction of Charlie Naked and feature: Charlie Naked - Guitar Ken Watkins - Guitar Jeff Miller - Bass Ruthie Langston - Cello Pete Sullivan - Saxophones Phil Krieg - Theremin Tom Zermeno - Percussion
They are providing all the music and sound effects for my production of Elmer Rice's "The Adding Machine". They are also providing all the pre-show music - and here's a sample of them practicing for that...
enjoy, and come see one of the last two performances if yr in Houston...
Kid Ornery

item.title: 30 Minutes with Avijit
item.description: Terribly busy with "The Adding Machine" but here's 30 or so minutes with the first "improv" group Charlie Naked and I put together... It's much more riff/song based, but everything you hear here is a first take with no discussion of what we're playing before we start... Well, Mozo X did overdub the voz on "kissing ann magnuson" - our little tribute to Bongwater... 1. Nicoderm 2. Freakout Luau '68 3. Searching for my Flashlight 4. Kissing Ann Magnuson 5. John Bell All these tracks are available on various Avijit Cd's - http://www.cafepress.com/charlienaked if yr in H-town come see "The Adding Machine" - http://www.myspace.com/theaddingmachine the pictue has nothing to do with "avijit" but I'd rather look at Jenni, Melissa and Aileen...wouldn't you?
item.dc:creator: Kid Ornery
item.itunes:summary:

item.title: William Switzer - The Final Solo Recordings
item.description: William Switzer was Jason Bill and Mike Switzer (Kid Ornery's given name). We released one CD - The Illusion of Technique - on Fleece Records... The critics, well, they mostly ignored it, but some, well, some hated it. The girl I dated for a brief period after we recorded it asked if we were depressed at the time, and if we were listening to what we were doing... and of course we think it's a fun record, and we were listening as closely as either of us were capable of at the time... This is our last duo session - probably recorded at the Charalambihouse. I also have unreleased trio sessions with Dave Dove, and Heather Murray. Just got a call from a friend saying that Christina Carter will be on the next DJ Shadow record... crazy... I need to see if I can contact her about releasing some of the CCM recordings - Christina Carter, Charlie Naked, Mike Switzer - some of her earliest piano work and all kinds of interesting noises. But anyway, back to William Switzer... We were awesome and sometimes unlistenable...but mostly awesome. Jason went on to record with Jack Rose and Migrantes... I went on to do all the crazy stuff you've been listening too on previous eps of this podcast... and now - I'm directing a play - http://www.myspace.com/theaddingmachine and Charlie Naked along with members of TDU, Free Radicals, Infant Mortality Rate and Friendship Bracelets (among others) are making the music for the show... should be amazing... blah blah blah... just listen to the craziness already - 4 tracks various instrumentation K.O.

item.title: EXTEMPORAMA! GAY PRIDE! Fist of Kong/The Defenestration Unit live at Super Happy Fun Land
item.description: Yes, it's true... more TDU for you... this time with our sister band - Fist of Kong FOK is Charlie Naked and Danny McMahon - with - Tom Zermeno, Robert Pearson, John Atlas, Rose Lange, Jim Otterson, Mike Switzer... then we turn into TDU and add Jeff Miller and Kirk "Monkeyboy" Suddreath we all play together for a bit of "Space is the Place" then nonTDU folks leave for the most part...though I think John and Rose kept playing with us. The piece starts with Charlie and Danny doing their best Don Cherry, with Charlie on bamboo clarinet and Danny playing some kind of tiny harp... anyway, check it out... it was a good show... and it was the night of the Gay Pride parade - hence the title...
item.dc:creator: Kid Ornery
item.itunes:summary: Yes, it's true... more TDU for you... this time with our sister band - Fist of Kong FOK is Charlie Naked and Danny McMahon - with - Tom Zermeno, Robert Pearson, John Atlas, Rose Lange, Jim Otterson, Mike Switzer... then we turn into TDU and add Jeff Miller and Kirk "Monkeyboy" Suddreath we all play together for a bit of "Space is the Place" then nonTDU folks leave for the most part...though I think John and Rose kept playing with us. The piece starts with Charlie and Danny doing their best Don Cherry, with Charlie on bamboo clarinet and Danny playing some kind of tiny harp... anyway, check it out... it was a good show... and it was the night of the Gay Pride parade - hence the title...

item.title: TDU SAVES PUPPIES!! LIVE AT HELIOS!!! 06/25/06
item.description: TDU's big one-oh continues... We played a gig today that was a benefit for HPPL (www.HPPL.org) - upstairs at Helios (www.heliosrising.org) and... well... here it is... 1. Saturn on Taft 2. Back to Earth Charlie Naked, Kid Ornery, Jim Otterson, Tom Zermeno, Jeff Miller, and Kirk "Monkeyboy" Suddreath

Charlie Naked, Kid Ornery, Jim Otterson, Tom Zermeno, Jeff Miller, and Kirk "Monkeyboy" Suddreath

item.title: Goodbye Electric Prince
item.description: I know, I know... I promised you TDU for the rest of June, well that's before I knew Justin Crane (AKA The Electric Prince) was leaving town... so here's yr bonus non-tdu related podcast... Justin plays on all this stuff: Goodbye Electric Prince 1. Guitar/Tromone 1 - E.P./K.O. - unreleased 2. Searching For My Flashlight - Avijit - File Under... 3. Guitar/Tromone 2 - E.P./K.O - unreleased 4. ...and on drums, Justin Crane - Avijit - Live and Intimidated 5. Guitar/Tromone 3 - E.P./K.O - unreleased 6. You're a Freak - E.P./K.O. - Sugar Shack cover - unreleased 7. Guitar/Tromone 4 - E.P./K.O - unreleased 8. Pennies From Heaven - The Magic Bullets - unreleased rehearsal tape bands I was in with Justin that aren't represented include Wheat, and Silver City Trading Post, and others I'm sure...

item.title: The Defenestration Unit - Wackiness Ensues
item.description: Time once again for another installment of "Kid Ornery Presents..." digging once again into the vaults of TDU I present this audio collage time travel experience...the years of TDU melt away, change, etc... This one features some vocalizations, lots of theremin, and a funk instrumental in the middle... Part 3 of TDU's 10th Anniversary Series 1. 2 minutes w/ Ms. C.V. - 12/11/05 Rehearsal Tapes 2. Chocolate Meat - Double Speed Will Make Us Famous - Vol 1 3. The Cold Beauty of the Rugged Martian Terrain - The Wooly Monkey as "Mona" 4. Tales of Brave Foolysses - We Travel the Freeways 5. Asskicker Jones - Sweatbox 6. Little Things Get Bigger - That Old Time Crazy Jazz 7. The Headhunter at Home - Double Speed Will Make Us Famous - Vol 2 8. Closing Remarks - Dark Haggis http://kidornery.podOmatic.com http://kidornery.podOmatic.com/rss2.xml This one is a little early because I'm thinking of a bonus non-TDU specific podcast midweek, and then another TDU at the end of the week in preparation for our shows Saturday and Sunday. anyway, enjoy!

item.itunes:summary:

item.title: The Defenestration Unit - Another Fine Mess
item.description: Part Two of TDU's 10 Year Anniversary Series - A brief totally random overview of TDU history - in more than one part 1. Even Dwarfs Started Small (excerpt) - from "Massage The Joint" 2. We Three Kings - from "A TDU Christmas" 3. Screaming Hell - from "Drenched by Rain and Reverb" 4. Leroy's Groove/Will the Circle be Unbroken - from "Sweatbox" 5. Never been fond of the water - From "TDU060406" A mix of several different periods of The Defenestration Unit... the last bit being from a recent practice...

Part Two of TDU's 10 Year Anniversary Series - A brief totally random overview of TDU history - in more than one part

item.title: The Defenstration Unit - Live at Rudyards
item.description: The Defenestration Unit celebrates our 10 year anniversary this month... so the rest of June will be TDU month here at the house of Ornery. This recording comes from a brief period in the bands life when we played songs and had a singer. She's under contract now, so I won't mention her name, but she's awesome... We brought her in to do "Theme de Yoyo" and that sounded so good we added the Nina Simone cover - next thing ya know we were working up a set, and soon free jazz legends, TDU, were an R&B/Soul band... The picture is at least the right horn section, even if it is from a different gig... next week classic TDU, something from Sweatbox, and a preview of the newest NEW TDU!!! Track Listing: 1. Feeling Good 2. Theme De Yoyo 3. Breath of Fresh Air 4. All Mine 5. Space is the Place/Transmission ENJOY!!!
item.dc:creator: Kid Ornery

We brought her in to do "Theme de Yoyo" and that sounded so good we added the Nina Simone cover - next thing ya know we were working up a set, and soon free jazz legends, TDU, were an R&B/Soul band...

Track Listing:
1. Feeling Good 2. Theme De Yoyo 3. Breath of Fresh Air 4. All Mine 5. Space is the Place/Transmission
ENJOY!!!

item.title: Last Bastions - Tomorrow Never Knows
item.description: Thought I'd combine the themes of the last two podcasts and give you what may be the last bastions only cover. This piece was comissioned by trombonist David Dove and later released in a private edition of 17. It includes the quietest music we've ever played (the begining and end), a beatles cover (the whole thing) and us playing in front of people who were not expecting us (the horns were recorded on the streets of downtown houston on a Friday night.) I'm pretty proud of this one. Hope you enjoy it.

item.title: Last Bastions - Points/Songs
item.description: Two unfinished Last Bastions projects combined with one track from "Music for Bathing" (w/ Ben Lind). Last Bastions are Kid Ornery and Charlie Naked. Songs were meant to have singers, but we never found any... The "Music for Bathing" track has vocals which makes it as songlike as anything in our catalog... You'll get points as soon as ya hear 'em... very process oriented pieces...
item.dc:creator: Kid Ornery
item.itunes:summary: Two unfinished Last Bastions projects combined with one track from "Music for Bathing" (w/ Ben Lind). Last Bastions are Kid Ornery and Charlie Naked. Songs were meant to have singers, but we never found any... The "Music for Bathing" track has vocals which makes it as songlike as anything in our catalog... You'll get points as soon as ya hear 'em... very process oriented pieces...

item.title: Kid Ornery presents... Covers Vol. 1
item.description: A collection of covers from Kid Ornery and friends... 1. 1969 - Kid Ornery 2. I Save Cigarette Butts - Ornery (kid ornery, charlie naked, justin crane) 3. It's all over now baby blue - Kid Ornery and Jack Babylon 4. Caravan - The Defenestration Unit 5. Pretty Singing Boys - Kid Ornery w/Charlie Naked 6. Penetration - The Slightly Nervous Boys w/Bliss Blood 7. Space is the Place - The Defenestration Unit 8. Anne - Kid Ornery 9. Venus in Furs - Charlie Naked and Kid Ornery
